meanings.sent1: We must perpetuate the tradition of planting trees every spring.
meanings.sent2: The museum works to perpetuate the memory of the ancient civilization.
meanings.sent3: The never-ending story perpetuates the adventures of a brave hero.
meanings.sent4: Her smile perpetuates warmth in the hearts of everyone she meets.
meanings.sent5: The old lighthouse perpetuates its guiding light through stormy nights.

meanings.definition: Preserve (something valued) from oblivion or extinction.
meanings.sent1: To perpetuate the recipe, we must pass it down to future generations.
meanings.sent2: The historical society aims to perpetuate the artifacts of the past.
meanings.sent3: The secret recipe perpetuates the taste of grandma's famous cookies.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to music perpetuates the soulful melodies of the past.
meanings.sent5: The ancient manuscript perpetuates the wisdom of our ancestors.

meanings.sent1: The monument was built to perpetuate the heroism of fallen soldiers.
meanings.sent2: Her legacy will perpetuate her kindness and generosity.
meanings.sent3: The catchy jingle perpetuates in my mind, making me hum all day.
meanings.sent4: His words perpetuate a sense of hope in times of despair.
meanings.sent5: The painting perpetuates the beauty of a serene landscape.
